summary: The UK government is actively engaging with stakeholders following the closure of a formal consultation period on AI regulation on June 21, 2023. This engagement is part of the National AI Strategy, which aims to establish a pro-innovation framework for governing AI. The government has outlined its proposals in a white paper, emphasizing the importance of regulation in fostering an environment conducive to AI development. The UK Science and Technology Framework identifies AI as a critical technology and aims to position the UK as a global leader in AI by 2030, promoting innovation, investment, and public trust in AI technologies.
takeaways: The formal consultation on AI regulation closed on June 21, 2023.
The UK government is committed to a pro-innovation approach to AI regulation as outlined in the National AI Strategy.
AI is identified as one of five critical technologies in the UK Science and Technology Framework.
The government aims to strengthen the UK's position as a global leader in AI by fostering innovation and public trust.
